trans-unit.source: Save a file with a picker
trans-unit.target: Save a file with a picker

trans-unit.source: Use FileSavePicker to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.
trans-unit.target: Use FileSavePicker to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.

trans-unit.source: Save a file with a picker
trans-unit.target: Save a file with a picker

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: FileSavePicker
trans-unit.target: FileSavePicker

trans-unit.source: StorageFile
trans-unit.target: StorageFile

trans-unit.source: Use [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.
trans-unit.target: Use [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Also see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994).
trans-unit.target: **Note** Also see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).

trans-unit.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).

trans-unit.source: Access permissions to the location
trans-unit.target: Access permissions to the location

trans-unit.source: See [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).
trans-unit.target: See [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).

trans-unit.source: FileSavePicker: step-by-step
trans-unit.target: FileSavePicker: step-by-step

trans-unit.source: Use a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) so that your users can specify the name, type, and location of a file to save.
trans-unit.target: Use a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) so that your users can specify the name, type, and location of a file to save.

trans-unit.source: Create, customize, and show a file picker object, and then save data via the returned [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object that represents the file picked.
trans-unit.target: Create, customize, and show a file picker object, and then save data via the returned [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object that represents the file picked.

trans-unit.source: Create and customize the FileSavePicker
trans-unit.target: Create and customize the FileSavePicker

trans-unit.source: Set properties on the file picker object that are relevant to your users and your app.
trans-unit.target: Set properties on the file picker object that are relevant to your users and your app.

trans-unit.source: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see [Guidelines and checklist for file pickers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465182).
trans-unit.target: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see [Guidelines and checklist for file pickers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465182).

trans-unit.source: This example sets three properties: [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207880), [**FileTypeChoices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207875) and [**SuggestedFileName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207878).
trans-unit.target: This example sets three properties: [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207880), [**FileTypeChoices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207875) and [**SuggestedFileName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207878).

trans-unit.source: **Note** [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) objects display the file picker using the [**PickerViewMode.List**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207891).
trans-unit.target: **Note** [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) objects display the file picker using the [**PickerViewMode.List**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207891).

trans-unit.source: Because our user is saving a document or text file, the sample sets [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207880) to the app's local folder by using [**LocalFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241621).
trans-unit.target: Because our user is saving a document or text file, the sample sets [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207880) to the app's local folder by using [**LocalFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241621).

trans-unit.source: Set [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854) to a location appropriate for the type of file being saved, for example Music, Pictures, Videos, or Documents.
trans-unit.target: Set [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854) to a location appropriate for the type of file being saved, for example Music, Pictures, Videos, or Documents.

trans-unit.source: From the start location, the user can navigate to other locations.
trans-unit.target: From the start location, the user can navigate to other locations.

trans-unit.source: Because we want to make sure our app can open the file after it is saved, we use [**FileTypeChoices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207875) to specify file types that the sample supports (Microsoft Word documents and text files).
trans-unit.target: Because we want to make sure our app can open the file after it is saved, we use [**FileTypeChoices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207875) to specify file types that the sample supports (Microsoft Word documents and text files).

trans-unit.source: Make sure all the file types that you specify are supported by your app.
trans-unit.target: Make sure all the file types that you specify are supported by your app.

trans-unit.source: Users will be able to save their file as any of the file types you specify.
trans-unit.target: Users will be able to save their file as any of the file types you specify.

trans-unit.source: They can also change the file type by selecting another of the file types that you specified.
trans-unit.target: They can also change the file type by selecting another of the file types that you specified.

trans-unit.source: The first file type choice in the list will be selected by default: to control that, set the [**DefaultFileExtension**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207873) property.
trans-unit.target: The first file type choice in the list will be selected by default: to control that, set the [**DefaultFileExtension**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207873) property.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The file picker also uses the currently selected file type to filter which files it displays, so that only file types that match the selected files types are displayed to the user.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The file picker also uses the currently selected file type to filter which files it displays, so that only file types that match the selected files types are displayed to the user.

trans-unit.source: To save the user some typing, the example sets a [**SuggestedFileName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207878).
trans-unit.target: To save the user some typing, the example sets a [**SuggestedFileName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207878).

trans-unit.source: Make your suggested file name relevant to the file being saved.
trans-unit.target: Make your suggested file name relevant to the file being saved.

trans-unit.source: For example, like Word, you can suggest the existing file name if there is one, or the first line of a document if the user is saving a file that does not yet have a name.
trans-unit.target: For example, like Word, you can suggest the existing file name if there is one, or the first line of a document if the user is saving a file that does not yet have a name.

trans-unit.source: Show the FileSavePicker and save to the picked file
trans-unit.target: Show the FileSavePicker and save to the picked file

trans-unit.source: Display the file picker by calling [**PickSaveFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207876).
trans-unit.target: Display the file picker by calling [**PickSaveFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207876).

trans-unit.source: After the user specifies the name, file type, and location, and confirms to save the file, **PickSaveFileAsync** returns a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object that represents the saved file.
trans-unit.target: After the user specifies the name, file type, and location, and confirms to save the file, **PickSaveFileAsync** returns a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object that represents the saved file.

trans-unit.source: You can capture and process this file now that you have read and write access to it.
trans-unit.target: You can capture and process this file now that you have read and write access to it.

trans-unit.source: The example checks that the file is valid and writes its own file name into it.
trans-unit.target: The example checks that the file is valid and writes its own file name into it.

trans-unit.source: Also see [Creating, writing, and reading a file](quickstart-reading-and-writing-files.md).
trans-unit.target: Also see [Creating, writing, and reading a file](quickstart-reading-and-writing-files.md).

trans-unit.source: **Tip** You should always check the saved file to make sure it is valid before you perform any other processing.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** You should always check the saved file to make sure it is valid before you perform any other processing.

trans-unit.source: Then, you can save content to the file as appropriate for your app, and provide appropriate behavior if the picked file is not valid.
trans-unit.target: Then, you can save content to the file as appropriate for your app, and provide appropriate behavior if the picked file is not valid.
